channel.title: Uncompatible Chat Text
channel.description:
How can I fix chat? It's all scrambled. Is there a quick fix to this?
[img]http://projectrainbow.net/images/sg.png[/img]
[img]http://projectrainbow.net/images/crs.png[/img]

item.title: Uncompatible Chat Text
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

whackatre:

The method is private void method107(int i, int j, Stream stream, Player player) (I think), and so far, the code looks identical in both clients.

Be sure to look everywhere before the part where it displays the text in that method. It could be an unexpected byte that is throwing it off, or any number of reasons. And if it decompresses/“unpacks” text anywhere, be sure to check that method

http://pastebin.com/0ER8hhVx

That’s the RuneLimited method107, in case you want to look at that. I’m pretty sure I’ve had this bug with it before

Read full topic

item.title: Uncompatible Chat Text
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:6, topic:443101”][quote author=whackatre link=topic=545790.msg4001037#msg4001037 date=1337996629]

The clients have different decompression methods, or the server is sending the packet differently. I ran into this problem when I tried using the unpack method provided in PI, however it is flawed and does not work.

That’s what I thought… I’m not sure if it is server sided or client sided, could you give me a hint as to where the decompression methods are? Is it TextInput?
[/quote]
Client sided. Not sure what client you’re using, but it would be wherever the client receives the chat packet and handles it.[/quote]

The method is private void method107(int i, int j, Stream stream, Player player) (I think), and so far, the code looks identical in both clients.

Read full topic

item.title: Uncompatible Chat Text
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“whackatre, post:5, topic:443101”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=545790.msg4001030#msg4001030 date=1337995730]
The clients have different decompression methods, or the server is sending the packet differently. I ran into this problem when I tried using the unpack method provided in PI, however it is flawed and does not work.
[/quote]

That’s what I thought… I’m not sure if it is server sided or client sided, could you give me a hint as to where the decompression methods are? Is it TextInput?[/quote]
Client sided. Not sure what client you’re using, but it would be wherever the client receives the chat packet and handles it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Loveandpower:

Looks like you nulled your playerupdating system somehow. Note the null names.

Yeah, those two servers aren’t mine.
